alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 20 at 8:39PM MDT until May 20 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH SATURDAY FROM NOON THROUGH EARLY EVENING FOR THE MIDDLE AND LOWER RIO GRANDE VALLEY AND WEST CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY, AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS AND WELL ABOVE AVERAGE TEMPERATURES... .Winds will continue to weaken through the evening, and humidities will continue to increase, so the Red Flag Warning for Friday is being allowed to expire. Critical fire weather conditions will be possible once again for the middle and lower Rio Grande Valley as well as the west central highlands Saturday afternoon into early evening. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Middle Rio Grande Valley and West Central Highlands Saturday from late morning through early evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; West Central Highlands
